image.altText: A grieving mother surrounded by family.

items.synopsis: Jason Kennison's family has paid tribute to an "amazing son, amazing brother, amazing uncle" who "suddenly fell ill" while descending Mount Everest on Friday morning.

title.children: Mum recalls telling mountaineer son 'I'll always love you' before his death on Mount Everest

image.altText: A man wearing a hockey mask and hoodie stands outside in front of an old airport control tower.

items.synopsis: Cartels threaten and bribe border workers to help them bring in cocaine, a bikie and former airport worker says.

title.children: Latin American drug cartels are using Australian airport staff to import massive quantities of cocaine, insider says

image.altText: image: sEAL

items.synopsis: Frenchman Antoine Dicenta will spend at least 18 years behind bars for his part in a failed attempt to import drugs with a street value of up to $185 million into Western Australia.

title.children: Final player jailed for 26 years after giant seal helps foil massive Abrolhos Islands drug smuggling attempt

image.altText: Man with a white cap and black hoodie looking into the camera

items.synopsis: Jamie Phillip Mongoo, who broke into a family home in the state's Midwest and climbed a young girl's loft-style bed, has been sentenced for home burglary, assault, stealing, trespassing and fraud.

title.children: Man who invaded 8yo girl's WA bedroom jailed for more than two years on multiple charges

image.altText: A Transperth train pulling into a station.

items.synopsis: The 18-month closure of the Armadale line will have a big impact on the 10,000 commuters who use the transport route each day. Here's everything you need to know about how to minimise the disruption.

title.children: Here's what you need to know about one of the largest rail shutdowns WA has ever seen

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Dutton and Linda Burney. He is speaking sternly and she is listening intently.

items.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says the Indigenous Voice to Parliament will "re-racialise our nation" in a speech the Indigenous Australians Minister Linda Burney describes as "disinformation" and scare-mongering.

title.children: Dutton says Indigenous Voice will 're-racialise' the country in a speech Burney describes as 'disinformation'

image.altText: Penny Wong pursues her lips as she looks tentatively into the distance.

items.synopsis: The foreign minister says more progress is needed before the prime minister goes to China.

title.children: Penny Wong says Anthony Albanese won't visit China unless 'progress' is made to resolve trade arguments

image.altText: A car with a smashed window at night

items.synopsis: A car found burnt out nearby is believed to be connected to the shooting.

title.children: Police sources believe fatal shooting of man in Sydney's south-west is gang related

image.altText: Win Bakri Daki and Antony Blinken shake hands sitting at a dark timber desk with a man standing behind near US and PNG flags.

items.synopsis: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken signs a Defence Cooperation Agreement between the United States and PNG, a leaked draft of which suggests it might open the door to a substantial US military presence in the country, as well as potentially offering American personnel in PNG some protection from prosecution.

title.children: United States and Papua New Guinea strengthen defence ties with new security agreement

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

items.synopsis: NSW Police Commissioner Karen Webb says it "takes courage" not to view the body-cam footage of an elderly woman being tasered, and that she wants "a complete picture" of the incident before she looks at it, as the woman's family asks media for privacy.

title.children: NSW Police boss defends not watching body-cam video of 95yo being tasered, family asks for privacy

image.altText: A four-metre shark cruises off the coast of Scarborough Beach, Perth. May 1, 2014.

items.synopsis: WA Fisheries Minister Don Punch says shark fishing and swimming are incompatible at popular beaches and changing the legislation to ban it is simple.

title.children: Shark fishing ban at Perth and regional swimming beaches imminent, says minister

image.altText: People standing together holding signs

items.synopsis: Hundreds of ABC staff around the country rallied in support of veteran journalist Stan Grant, who last week announced he would step away from media commitments due to racial abuse.

title.children: ABC staff rally in show of support for Stan Grant

image.altText: A young woman holds a two-year-old girl in her arms, with her child holding a positive pregnancy test in her hands.

items.synopsis: When Kirsty Bryant received a uterus transplant in January — after her mother donated hers — she did not expect to fall pregnant so soon, with her new baby now growing in the same womb that carried her.

title.children: 'Surreal' news as Kirsty falls pregnant just weeks after nation's first uterus transplant — using her mum's womb

image.altText: An Indigenous woman with shoulder-length grey hair poses for a portrait in front of shelves of books, smiling warmly.

items.synopsis: Indigenous author Debra Dank has won a record four out of 14 NSW Premier's Literary Awards and $85,000 for her memoir of family and place, and says she hopes its success draws attention to the "soul destroying" destruction of her Country.

title.children: ‘Accidental writer’ wins $85,000 and top prize at literary awards for memoir of family and Country

image.altText: Sign with Afterpay logo sitting on a counter

items.synopsis: The federal government will classify buy now, pay later options as credit products, as part of sweeping changes to protect both consumers and the industry. Here's what it means in practice.

title.children: Are you a regular Afterpay or Zip customer? Here's what the changing buy now, pay later laws mean for you

image.altText: Rescuers walk past destroyed vehicles and damaged brick buildings inside a firefighters' depot.

items.synopsis: Missile and drone strikes across Ukraine intensify after a lull of a few months, while Russia's ambassador to the US warns sending F-16 attack jets to Kyiv raises questions of NATO's involvement.

title.children: Russia launches air attack on Ukraine's Dnipro, eight hurt

image.altText: Akila hugs her young daughter, who is hugging her around the neck.

items.synopsis: Last year, the ABC issued a call-out asking readers to share their stories about how they were coping with rising interest rates and prices for everyday goods and services. Here's what some of them say they are doing now, nearly 12 months later, to make ends meet.

title.children: 'All I could do was cry': Australians reveal how they're dealing with the cost-of-living crisis

image.altText: A man in a dark suit and red tie.

items.synopsis: ACT Detective Superintendent Scott Moller tells the inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann that he was under pressure from Brittany Higgins, the media and other police members to charge Mr Lehrmann.

title.children: Senior ACT police officer tells inquiry there was 'significant pressure' to charge Bruce Lehrmann

image.altText: A elderly man holds a flag in the air and shouts outside the party's headquarters.

items.synopsis: Greek voters will have go to the polls again after the ruling New Democracy party scored a landslide election win at the weekend, but still fell short of the seats needed to form a majority government

title.children: Greece heading to another election despite landslide win for ruling party

image.altText: Dr Ella Stack

items.synopsis: A trailblazer across medicine and local politics, Dr Stack was one of Darwin's first doctors to open a private general practice and the city's first female mayor.

title.children: Dr Ella Stack, mayor who guided Darwin through Cyclone Tracy aftermath, dies aged 94

image.altText: A bucket full of murky water in a shower.

items.synopsis: The EPA says it is concerned that Cadia Valley Operations is failing to meet its obligations following reports from residents that dust rising from its mine near Orange in NSW is contaminating their water and making their kids sick.

title.children: Gold mine to be probed after heavy metals found in residents' blood, rainwater

image.altText: Noel Payne stands astride a rusty old motorbike in a backyard, holding the swept back handlebars, wearing a shirt with flames on

items.synopsis: A court has heard Walpeup man Noel Payne was violent and abusive towards his wife and another woman who lived at his property before he was murdered in 2020. His wife Rebecca Payne is to be sentenced for his murder.

title.children: Woman to be sentenced for murdering abusive husband with spiked lemon biscuits

image.altText: A man in a suit

items.synopsis: Constable Ryan Barlow is found guilty of assaulting an Indigenous teenager during an arrest in Sydney in 2020, in which he held the boy's arms and used a "leg sweep" to take him to the ground.

title.children: Police officer guilty of assaulting Indigenous teen with 'leg sweep'

image.altText: A security camera at an airport captures a car park and stationary airplanes. Behind them a meteor is falling.

items.synopsis: An online community keen to get its hands on a piece of Saturday's meteorite is collating videos of the event and expects to triangulate its location by the end of the week.

title.children: Meteorite hunters say 'there's a chance' people will find space rock near Queensland town

image.altText: A young woman holding up an anti-fracking sign in front of another woman wearing hiking gear

items.synopsis: Police were called after dozens of protesters stormed the finish line in protest of the NT government's green-lighting of fracking in the Beetaloo Basin.

title.children: NT chief minister in tears after confrontation with protesters during outback race

image.altText: Gusmao kissing

items.synopsis: Former guerilla fighter and independence hero Xanana Gusmao is in prime position to win Timor-Leste's parliamentary election, with more than half of the votes counted after Sunday's poll.

title.children: Former guerrilla fighter Xanana Gusmao in prime spot to take Timor-Leste's election

image.altText: Aqua-coloured graphic image depicting a woman with short hair surrounded by psychadelic imagery and mushrooms

items.synopsis: Doctors told Lindy Bok she had two years to live. The psychedelic compound found in "magic mushrooms" is helping her face death, and get "20 years of therapy in one hit".

title.children: 'Really, mum, you're going to take drugs?': Lindy is dying, so she leaned in to life

image.altText: a woman and a man holding a baby stand next to each other smiling on a beach, they are each holding a beer bottle

items.synopsis: The bodies of 26-year-old Jane Strong and 22-year-old Eli Johnson were found inside the burnt-out caravan. Ms Strong's partner was also injured in the blaze.

title.children: Community in shock after fatal caravan fire on rural southern Queensland property

image.altText: Two men exit the doors of a court building. The lawyer is wearing a suit, the other man is wearing shorts and a jumper.

items.synopsis: In sentencing former national rock climbing coach Stephen Mitchell, a judge said he had abused a "gross disparity of age and power".

title.children: Former Australian rock climbing coach sentenced to more than 13 years in prison for sex offences

image.altText: 5 people on a dark background. There are five circles below them: green, grey, orange, yellow and red

items.synopsis: Use the ABC's Promise Tracker to check in on the government's progress over its first year.

title.children: Promise tracker: The Labor government's 2022 election commitments

image.altText: an older man looking forward

items.synopsis: The NSW One Nation leader is set to defend proceedings launched by the Independent Sydney MP over an alleged "defamatory and homophobic" tweet.

title.children: Mark Latham's lawyer labels Alex Greenwich defamation action an 'absolute try-on'

image.altText: A beekeeper in a blue shirt and Akubra looking at a bee hive

items.synopsis: The New Zealand intellectual property umpire has sided with Australia's move to block New Zealand honey producers trademarking the word manuka.

title.children: Australia scores another win in lengthy trans-Tasman manuka honey war

image.altText: A greyscale image of Josh Freese sitting at a drum kit, shrugging wearing a "hello, my name is: Josh" sticker

items.synopsis: The band introduces their new drummer in a star-studded live stream video featuring Chad Smith, Tommy Lee and a few poodles.

title.children: Foo Fighters reveal Josh Freese as their new drummer after Taylor Hawkins' death

items.synopsis: For the first time in its 20-year history, Like A Version is getting the Hottest 100 treatment. Here's everything you need to know ahead of the countdown.

title.children: Four things you might not know about Like A Version ahead of its Hottest 100 countdown

image.altText: Men standing on a tractor

items.synopsis: One of the very first tractors made in Australia now has pride of place in the National Museum in Canberra after being repatriated from the United States.

title.children: This Australian-made vintage tractor escaped the scrap heap and now has pride of place in a national museum
